title: simulation-example
code: sim_from_params <- run_simulation(niter = 100,                                   maxt = 5,                                    type = "power",                                    method = "kmeans",                                    dmin = 0.5,                                    rmin = 0.5,                                   n = 50,                                   nind = 3,                                   progress = FALSE)

title: simulation-example
code: sim <- sim_clust(nclust = 2, n = 100, dmin = 5, rmin = 0, nind = 2)  dat <- clustersimulation:::.get_inds(sim) dat <- clustersimulation:::.check_data(dat) udata <- prep_user_data(dat)  sim_from_udata <- run_simulation(niter = 100,                                  maxt = 5,                                   type = "power",                                   method = "kmeans",                                   dmin = 0.5,                                   udata = udata,                                  progress = FALSE)

title: Simulate data for cluster analysis
text: goal clustersimulation provide set utilities functions Shiny app perform Monte Carlo simulations focus inferential errors (type 1 error) statistical power. simulation can performed either providing dataset manually setting required parameters.

title: Simulate data for cluster analysis
text: can install development version clustersimulation GitHub : package installed Shiny app (running locally) can used using: R/ folder contains functions used Shiny can used also within standard R script implement complex extensive simulations. demo version app can accessed online https://psicostat.shinyapps.io/clustersimulation-demo/

title: kmeans_clust — kmeans_clust
text: Estimate number clusters using K-Means clustering selecting best solutions using silhouette value. finding best solutions, Duda-Hart test used check least two clusters.

title: kmeans_clust — kmeans_clust
code: kmeans_clust(data, cmin = 2, cmax = 5, alpha = 0.05, debug = FALSE)

title: kmeans_clust — kmeans_clust
text: data dataframe indicators used clustering columns. cmin minimum number cluster test. Default 2 cmax maximum number clusters test. Default 5. careful increasing cmax greatly increase computation time. alpha alpha value Duda-Hart test. Default 0.05 debug logical indicating silhouette values model returned

title: kmeans_clust — kmeans_clust
text: number estimated clusters

title: model_based_clust — model_based_clust
text: Estimate number clusters using mclust::Mclust() function.

title: model_based_clust — model_based_clust
text: data dataframe indicators used clustering columns. criteria criteria select best number clusters. One BIC lrt (likelihood ratio test). cmin minimum number cluster test. Default 1 cmax maximum number clusters test. Default 5. careful increasing cmax greatly increase computation time.

title: model_based_clust — model_based_clust
text: estimated number clusters

title: run_simulation — run_simulation
text: Function run simulation estimating type-1 error statistical power given set parameters.

title: run_simulation — run_simulation
code: run_simulation(   niter,   maxt = NULL,   type = c("power", "type1"),   method = c("mclust", "kmeans"),   cmax = 5,   dmin = 0,   dmax = NULL,   udata = NULL,   progress = TRUE,   updateProgress = NULL,   ... )

title: run_simulation — run_simulation
text: niter number iterations. maxt maximum time. number iterations finished within maximum time simulations ends. type character indicating simulation type. One type1 power. method character indicating method use estimating number cluster. One mclust kmeans. mclust call model_based_clust() function kmeans kmeans_clust() function. cmax maximum number clusters test. Default 5. careful increasing cmax significantly increase computation time. dmin lower bound range effect sizes (~Cohen's d like scale). dmax lower bound range effect sizes (~Cohen's d like scale). specified, dmax takes value dmin thus effect size indicators. udata list. output prep_user_data() function. Default NULL. udata NULL parameters passed ... ignored. progress logical indicating whether progress bar (using progress package) displayed. updateProgress function used fo displaying progress bar Shiny app. Default NULL ... named arguments passed sim_clust() function. udata null, parameters used simulation.

title: run_simulation — run_simulation
text: list containing estimated power type-1 error, number effective iterations, proportion iterations errors, vector estimated number clusters list simulation parameters.

title: run_simulation — run_simulation
code: if (FALSE) { run_simulation(niter = 100, maxt = 50, type = "type1", method = "mclust",  nclust = 2, n = 100, dmin = 0.5, rmin = 0.5, nind = 3) }

what: Simulate (un)clustered data assuming multivariate non-normal distributions — sim_clust
title: Simulate (un)clustered data assuming multivariate non-normal distributions — sim_clust
text: Simulate 1 2 clusters assuming multivariate non-normal distributions (specifying correlations, skewness, kurtosis, number indicators) degree separation (effect size) standard deviation units (standardized data). function can works two different ways. udata NULL: need specified left default value udata provided: parameters taken udata result calling prep_user_data function.

title: Simulate (un)clustered data assuming multivariate non-normal distributions — sim_clust
code: sim_clust(   nclust = 1,   n = NULL,   dmin = 0,   dmax = NULL,   rmin = NULL,   rmax = NULL,   nind = NULL,   skewmin = 0,   skewmax = NULL,   kurtmin = 0,   kurtmax = NULL,   pn1 = 0.5,   debug = FALSE,   udata = NULL )

title: Simulate (un)clustered data assuming multivariate non-normal distributions — sim_clust
text: nclust number clusters. Can 1 2, default 1 n total number observations. nclust 1, n number observations, nclust 2, n * (1 - pn1) number observations cluster 2. dmin lower bound range effect sizes (~Cohen's d like scale). dmax lower bound range effect sizes (~Cohen's d like scale). specified, dmax takes value dmin thus effect size indicators. rmin lower bound range correlations indicators. TODO correlation assumed within cluster. rmax upper bound range correlations indicators. specified, rmax takes value rmin thus using single value. nind number indicators skewmin lower bound range skewness. skewmax upper bound range skewness. specified, skewmax takes value skewmin thus using single value. kurtmin lower bound range kurtosi kurtmax upper bound range kurtosi. specified, kurtmax takes value kurtmin thus using single value. pn1 proportion observations belonging 1 cluster. Default 0.5. debug logical indicating returning vectors true values sampling range. udata list summary statistics use simulation. specified, previous arguments ignored.

title: Simulate (un)clustered data assuming multivariate non-normal distributions — sim_clust
text: dataframe simulated values

title: Simulate (un)clustered data assuming multivariate non-normal distributions — sim_clust

what: Simulate a dataset from a multivariate non-normal distribution — sim_data

title: Simulate a dataset from a multivariate non-normal distribution — sim_data
code: sim_data(n, d, Sigma, skew = NULL, kurt = NULL)

title: Simulate a dataset from a multivariate non-normal distribution — sim_data
text: n number observations d effect size (.e., vector means multivariate distribution). d vector length 1, value recycled creating vector length nrow(Sigma), otherwise d need vector length Sigma. function randomize sign d dimension. Sigma variance-covariance matrix skew vector skewnesses kurt vector kurtoses
